sub_title: Ass. Professor Urban Economic Develoment/ Head Education  at IHS, Erasmus University Rotterdam
summary:
Jan Fransen (Dr.) is Deputy Director of the IHS, in charge of international education and training.  The education and training includes a PhD and masters program, short courses in the Netherlands and abroad, and tailor made courses. He coordinates a course on Urban Theory in the master programme on Urban Management and Development (UMD) and co-coordinates a short course on Sustainable Local Economic Development. He is member of the advisory committee of the Africa Research Institute in Leiden and visiting scholar at POLIS University in Albania. He regularly lectures at universities around the globe. In a previous position, he worked for the International Labour Organisation (ILO) of the United Nations based in Eastern and Southern Africa.

Jan has over 20 years of experience in research, education and consultancy in the field of local economic development, with a particular interest in small firms, urban employment, capacity building, clustering, innovation systems, global value chains, labour-based technologies, institutional economics, evolutionary economics and complexity theory. Jan has completed a wide range of consultancy, training and research assignments in various positions including team leader, senior technical advisor, principal researcher and trainer. He has carried out assignments for the World Bank, European Commission, United Nations (UNDP, ILO, UN-HABITAT), NGO’s such as Cordaid and several national, regional and local governments world-wide. He has long and short-term working experience in over 20 countries, including Albania, China, Ecuador, Ethiopia, Kenya, Ghana, India, Indonesia, Malawi, Morocco, Mozambique, Myanmar, Netherlands, Namibia, Romania, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, South Korea, Tanzania, Uganda, Vietnam, Zambia and Zimbabwe.

profile_positions.description: My field of study is urban economic development, with a focus on developing and emerging economies. I am interested in among others urban resilience, innovation systems, smart cities, frugal innovations, informality, circular economy, competitiveness and complexity theory. I coordinate the IHS education program, research on smart cities within the EUR Vital Cities and Citizens program and urban research within the Centre of Frugal Innovation in Africa. I am member of the advisory committee of the Africa research Institute of Leiden University and visiting professor at POLIS, Albania.
profile_positions.title: Ass. Professor Urban Economic Develoment/ Head Education

profile_positions.description:
As Deputy Director, I am in charge of international education and training including a master program in urban management and development, PhD programme, short courses and tailor-made courses. Furthermore, I coordinate the course on urban theory in the master programme on Urban Management and Development and co-coordinate a short course on Sustainable Local Economic Development. I am also a member of the advisory committee of the Africa Research Institute in Leiden and visiting scholar at POLIS University in Albania.

My main field of interest is local economic development and in particular small firms, urban employment, capacity building, clustering, innovation systems, global value chains, labour-based technologies, institutional economics, evolutionary economics and complexity theory. My roles in research and advisory teams vary from team leader to senior technical advisor, principal researcher and trainer. Clients include the World Bank, European Commission, United Nations (UNDP, ILO, UN-HABITAT), NGO’s such as Cordaid and several national, regional and local governments world-wide. I have had the pleasure to work in over 20 countries, including Albania, China, Ecuador, Ethiopia, Kenya, Ghana, India, Indonesia, Malawi, Morocco, Mozambique, Myanmar, Netherlands, Namibia, Romania, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, South Korea, Tanzania, Uganda, Vietnam, Zambia and Zimbabwe.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director IHS

profile_positions.description: IHS is the international institute in urban management of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.description: I worked for 2 years in Harare as associate expert in employment relations and for four years in Nairobi at ILO ASIST in supporting labor-based upgrading of squatter settlements in Eastern Africa. This included an upgrading project in Hanna Nassif, Dar es Salaam.
